"Saint Chrysostom, in his work on 'The Priesthood,' defends deceit, if for a good purpose, by many Scriptural examples; ends his first book by asserting that it is often necessary, and that much benefit may arise from it; and begins his second book by saying that it ought not to be called 'deceit,' but 'good management.'"
